name: samba
desc: Standard Windows interoperability suite of programs for Linux and Unix

options.name: configText
options.desc: Verbatim contents of smb.conf. If null (default), use the autogenerated file from NixOS instead.

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba, which provides file and print services to Windows clients through the SMB/CIFS protocol.  If you use the firewall consider adding the following: services.samba.openFirewall = true;

options.name: enableNmbd
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba’s nmbd, which replies to NetBIOS over IP name service requests. It also participates in the browsing protocols which make up the Windows “Network Neighborhood” view.

options.name: enableWinbindd
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba’s winbindd, which provides a number of services to the Name Service Switch capability found in most modern C libraries, to arbitrary applications via PAM and ntlm_auth and to Samba itself.

options.name: extraConfig
options.desc: Additional global section and extra section lines go in here.

options.name: invalidUsers
options.desc: List of users who are denied to login via Samba.

options.name: nsswins
options.desc: Whether to enable the WINS NSS (Name Service Switch) plug-in. Enabling it allows applications to resolve WINS/NetBIOS names (a.k.a. Windows machine names) by transparently querying the winbindd daemon.

options.name: openFirewall
options.desc: Whether to automatically open the necessary ports in the firewall.

options.name: shares
options.desc: A set describing shared resources. See man smb.conf for options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of unspecified value
